paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the prevalence of BRCA2 mutations in pancreatic cancer patients, highlighting the association of these mutations with increased cancer risk.

functional_data.summary: BRCA2 mutations were significantly associated with an increased occurrence of pancreatic cancer.

variants.segregation_data: All BRCA2 mutation carriers were unselected pancreatic cancer patients.
variants.additional_notes: The presence of mutations in BRCA2 was significantly associated with positive family history for endometrial cancer.
key_quotes: All the BRCA2 mutation carriers were unselected PanC patients.
The presence of mutations in BRCA2 was significantly associated with an increased occurrence of PanC.

extraction_metadata.notes: Only one variant related to BRCA2 was identified in the text.
